law.catch_line: Unless a certificate is renewed for a 2-year term as provided in this section, a certificate expires...

text.section:
Unless a certificate is renewed for a 2-year term as provided in this section, a certificate expires on the first June 30 that comes:
after the effective date of the certificate; and
in an even-numbered year.

At least 30 days before the certificate expires, the Board shall mail to the certificate holder, at the last known address of the certificate holder:
a renewal application form;
a notice that states:
the date on which the current certificate expires; and
the date by which the Board must receive the renewal application for the renewal to be issued and mailed before the certificate expires; and
the amount of the certificate fee.
The Board shall renew the certificate of each certificate holder who meets the requirements of this section.
The Secretary may determine that certificates issued under this subtitle shall expire on a staggered basis.
